reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Progressive elimination of malaria in Madagascar

description.narrative: Madagascar - Malaria - Ministry of Public Health of the Republic of Madagascar - MOH. This program has the following goals: Reduce malaria-related mortality to zero by 2022.. Increase the number of districts in the pre-elimination phase from 3 to 64 by 2022.. Increase the number of districts in the elimination phase from 5 to 13 by 2022.. The objectives of this program are: Protect at least 90 percent of the population in the target areas by means of indoor residual spraying campaigns (IRSCs) and long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs).. Protect at least 80 percent of pregnant women by means of isoniazid preventive therapy in accordance with national guidelines.. Diagnose at least 95 percent of suspected malaria cases using rapid diagnostic tests (RDTs) or thick smear tests in accordance with national guidelines.. Treat at least 95 percent of confirmed malaria cases in accordance with national guidelines.. Encourage at least 80 percent of the population to adopt behaviors that support malaria prevention and treatment.. Ensure the promptness and completeness of reporting from all health care facilities remains at a minimum of 90 percent.

title.narrative: Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Percentage of health facilities with essential medicines and life-saving commodities in stock
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Proportion of households in targeted areas that received Indoor Residual Spraying during the reporting period
M&E-other 1: Percentage of districts submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria
Proportion of health facilities without stock-outs of key commodities during the reporting period
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
HW-other 1: Percentage of community health workers that are functional
